document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Kraatz, G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Kraatz, G. (1856 b) Naturgeschichte der Insecten Deutschlands. Abteilung 1, Coleoptera, vol. 2, Staphylinii. Lief. 1 - 2. Nicolaische Buchhandlung, Berlin, vii + 1 - 376 pp. [Note: nominal year of publication 1858]

subSubSection.paragraph: 14 species are included in this genus from the West Indies and South America.
Characters/Description: Seevers 1951: 740 (characters); Ashe 1984: 241 (characters in key), 255 (characters). Distribution.

bibRefCitation.author: Ashe, J. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Ashe, J. S. (1984) Generic revision of the subtribe Gyrophaenina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Aleocharinae) with a review of the described subgenera and major features of evolution. Quaestiones Entomologicae, 20 (3), 129 - 349.

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from South America.
Characters/Description: Ashe 1984: 241 (characters in key); Ashe 2002b: 130 (characters in key); Eldredge 2012c: 232 (characters in key).

Type species:
Ashea megacephala Kim & Ahn, 2015
Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.
Characters/Description: Y.H. Kim & Ahn 2015: 99 (characters in key).

bibRefCitation.author: Mulsant, E. & Rey, C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Mulsant, E. & Rey, C. (1871) Histoire Naturelle des Coleopteres de France. Brevipennes. Aleochariens [Huitieme Branche, Bolitocharaires]. Deyrolle Fils, Paris. 321 pp., pls. 1 - 5.

subSubSection.paragraph: 30 species are included in this genus from South America.
Key: Pace 2002: 126 , 128, 130, 133, 134 (some species of the genus); Pace 2008a: 247 (species of Ecuador and Peru ).
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Suriname , French Guiana , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Argentina .
Other regions: Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Bierig, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bierig, A. (1939 a) Neue neotropischen Staphylinidae der Subfamilie Aleocharinae (Coleoptera), (25. Beitrag zur Kenntnis der Staphylinden). Arbeiten uber Morphologische und Taxonomische Entomologie aus Berlin-Dahlem, 6 (1), 16 - 31, pl. 2 - 3.

subSubSection.paragraph: 2 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.

bibRefCitation.author: Sharp, D. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Sharp, D. S. (1883) Biologia Centrali-Americana, Insecta, Coleoptera, Staphylinidae. 1 (2), 145 - 312, pls. 5 - 7.

subSubSection.paragraph: 10 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Characters/Description: Ashe 1984: 241 (characters in key), 261 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 130 (characters in key). Distribution.
West Indies: Cuba , St. Vincent & Grenadines .
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: French Guiana , Ecuador , Brazil .

bibRefCitation.author: Pace, R.
bibRefCitation.refString: Pace, R. (1986 a) Aleocharinae del Peru (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae) (LXXXV Contributo alla conoscenza delle Aleocharinae). Redia, 69, 417 - 467.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.

bibRefCitation.author: Casey, T. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Casey, T. L. (1906) Observations on the staphylinid groups Aleocharinae and Xantholinini chiefly of America. Transactions of the Academy of Science of St. Louis, 16 (6), 125 - 434.

subSubSection.paragraph: 33 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Characters/Description: Seevers 1951: 732 (characters); Ashe 1984: 241 (characters in key), 249 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 130 (characters in key); Y.H. Kim & Ahn 2015: 99 (characters in key).
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Venezuela , French Guiana , Brazil , Argentina .

bibRefCitation.author: Mannerheim, C. G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Mannerheim, C. G. (1830) Precis d'un nouvel arrangement de la famille des brachelytres, de l'ordre des insectes coleopteres. St. Petersbourg. 87 pp.

bibRefCitation.author: Reitter, E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Reitter, E. (1909) Fauna Germanica. Die Kafer des Deutschen Reiches. Nach der analytischen Methode bearbeitet. 2, 1 - 392. Stuttgart: K. G. Lutz. pl. 41 - 80.

bibRefCitation.author: Eichelbaum, F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Eichelbaum, F. (1913) Verzeichniss der von mir in den Jahren 1903 und 1904 in Deutsch- und Britisch-Ostafrika eingesammelten Staphylinidae. Archiv fur Naturgeschichte, 79 A (3), 114 - 168.

bibRefCitation.author: Blackwelder, R. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Blackwelder, R. E. (1952) The generic names of the beetle family Staphylinidae, with an essay on genotypy. Bulletin of the United States National Museum, 200, iv + 483 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 93 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Characters/Description: Seevers 1951: 673 (characters); Ashe 1984: 241 (characters in key), 242 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 130 (characters in key); Y.H. Kim & Ahn 2015: 99 (characters in key).
West Indies: Cuba , Jamaica , Haiti , US Virgin Isl., Guadeloupe , St. Lucia , Saint Vincent & the Grenadines , Grenada .
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , French Guiana , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Bierig, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bierig, A. (1939 a) Neue neotropischen Staphylinidae der Subfamilie Aleocharinae (Coleoptera), (25. Beitrag zur Kenntnis der Staphylinden). Arbeiten uber Morphologische und Taxonomische Entomologie aus Berlin-Dahlem, 6 (1), 16 - 31, pl. 2 - 3.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.

bibRefCitation.refString: Bierig, A. (1939 a) Neue neotropischen Staphylinidae der Subfamilie Aleocharinae (Coleoptera), (25. Beitrag zur Kenntnis der Staphylinden). Arbeiten uber Morphologische und Taxonomische Entomologie aus Berlin-Dahlem, 6 (1), 16 - 31, pl. 2 - 3.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.

bibRefCitation.author: Casey, T. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Casey, T. L. (1906) Observations on the staphylinid groups Aleocharinae and Xantholinini chiefly of America. Transactions of the Academy of Science of St. Louis, 16 (6), 125 - 434.

bibRefCitation.author: Blackwelder, R. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Blackwelder, R. E. (1952) The generic names of the beetle family Staphylinidae, with an essay on genotypy. Bulletin of the United States National Museum, 200, iv + 483 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 20 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Characters/Description: Seevers 1951: 747 (characters); Ashe 1984: 241 (characters in key), 246 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 130 (characters in key); Y.H. Kim & Ahn 2015: 99 (characters in key).
South America: Colombia , French Guiana , Ecuador , Galapagos Isl., Peru , Brazil , Paraguay , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Ashe, J. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Ashe, J. S. (1984) Generic revision of the subtribe Gyrophaenina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Aleocharinae) with a review of the described subgenera and major features of evolution. Quaestiones Entomologicae, 20 (3), 129 - 349.

subSubSection.paragraph: 6 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Characters/Description: Ashe 1984: 240 (characters in key); Ashe 2002b: 130 (characters in key); Eldredge 2012c: 231 (characters), 232 (characters in key).
